TopicTitle: Servo's 1:1 Stock Replica Showcase [Newest Craft - MiG-23 ; An-2 ; SR-71 ; F-117]

Articles.Content:
1:1 Scale Replicas

Full stock, full scale, full power

In a scaled-down universe filled with scaled-down Kerbals, it's easy to forget how big real planes are. I've been building planes to the same scale of their real counterparts, enabling more accurate replicas with functioning mechanisms like swing wings, moving lift engines, and the odd GAU-8 Avenger.

Mikoyan Gurevich MiG-23 Flogger

Spoiler

A swing-wing fighter from the Soviet Union that gets a bad rap because it spent much of its combat history fighting against more modern planes in the hands of less-experienced pilots - against its contemporaries, it was a dangerous interceptor with lethal range and speed.

https://kerbalx.com/servo/MiG-23

Antonov An-2 Colt

Spoiler

The iconic An-2 was an unlikely plane to last much beyond its creation - a post-WWII biplane powered by an air-cooled piston engine driving a constant-pitch prop - but its ruggedness, easy handling, and versatility allowed the Colt to keep flying even today, 70 years after it first flew.

https://kerbalx.com/servo/Antonov-An-2

Lockheed SR-71 Blackbird

Spoiler

You know it, you love it, it's Lockheed's iconic bird of speed, now replicated in the modern replica era with an accurate, yet part-efficient design

https://kerbalx.com/servo/Lockheed-SR-71-Blackbird

 

North American F-86K/F-86L Sabre Dog

Spoiler

The lesser-known pure-interceptor variant of the F-86 saw service in dozens of air forces across the world - here's a bunch of them!

Download link: https://kerbalx.com/servo/F-86K-Sabre-Dog

The KerbalX link points to the unpainted F-86K as shown above. The page has a download link for the craft files and flags for the following:
* Royal Netherlands Air Force F-86K
* Philippine Air Force F-86D (two variants)
* United States Air Force F-86D
* Venezuelan Air Force F-86K 

 

North American T-2 Buckeye

Spoiler

A workhorse of an aircraft, the T-2 trained many generations of Naval Aviators between 1959 and 2008, despite never gaining any significant recognition or applause for doing so.

Download Link: https://kerbalx.com/servo/T-2-Buckeye

Douglas DC-3 / C-47 Skytrain

Spoiler

It's a rare aircraft that redefines both commercial and civil aviation, but for a generation of transport aircraft, the C-47 was the definition of Iconic, and the DC-3 defined a generation of airliners. 

This craft is a lean, mean 400 parts, and quite a joy to fly. Enjoy!  https://kerbalx.com/servo/C-47-Skytrain

General Dynamics F-111A Aardvark

Spoiler

A Collaboration with @HB Stratos, this mechanical wonder is packed with detail and functionality - and no DLC required!

Download: https://kerbalx.com/servo/F-111A-Aardvark

Consolidated PBY Catalina

Spoiler

The workhorse of the Pacific Theater - the PBY Catalina was a plane that can do anything you ask of it. Sub-hunting, search and rescue, water-bombing, and aerial reconnaissance aren't the limit

Craft Download; https://kerbalx.com/servo/PBY-Catalina

Vought F7U Cutlass

Spoiler

An odd duck of naval aviation, the Gutless Cutlass was ultimately more of a flight of fancy than a revolutionary new design.

Download link: https://kerbalx.com/servo/Vought-F7U-Cutlass

Martin P6M Seamaster

Spoiler

A would-be seaplane bomber that almost made it into service before technological progress caught up and doomed the project to obscurity.

A big old video with the story of the Seamaster - enjoy!

KerbalX link: https://kerbalx.com/servo/P6M-Seamaster

Ryan NYP - Spirit of St. Louis

Spoiler

Load up on fuel and take off for Paris in what is arguably the most famous single airplane in history - Charles Lindbergh's Spirit of St. Louis!

Download link: https://kerbalx.com/servo/Spirit-of-St-Louis

Mitsubishi F-2 "Viper Zero"

Spoiler

Japan's homegrown derivative of General Dynamics iconic F-16 is a delight to fly, in part thanks to the BendyTech stabilators providing excellent low-speed control.

Download Link: https://kerbalx.com/servo/Mitsubishi-F-2

 

Vought F8U Crusader

Spoiler

The Last of the Gunfighters rides again! This time, with a pure-stock variable-incidence wing

Download: https://kerbalx.com/servo/Vought-F8U-Crusader_2

Tech behind the wing: 

 

The Century Series

Convair F-102 Delta Dagger    Lockheed F-104 Starfigher    Republic F-105 Thunderchief    Convair F-106 Delta Dart

Spoiler

F-102  Delta Dagger - A flawed interceptor, the F-102 eventually proved itself by way of its successor, the Delta Dart.      https://kerbalx.com/servo/F-102-Delta-Dagger_2

F-104: This iconic interceptor/fighter is a hoot to fly, and extremely low part count for what it is. https://kerbalx.com/servo/F-104-Starfighter_2

F-105: Republic's troubled strike fighter, which got a second chance by becoming the seat of the first Wild Weasel Squadrons. https://kerbalx.com/servo/F-105-Thunderchief_2

F-106 Delta Dart: The Ultimate Interceptor, the F-106 was a mainstay of front-line air defense until the obsolescence of the dedicated interceptor.  https://kerbalx.com/servo/F-106-Delta-Dart_2

Lockheed F-117A "Nighthawk" Stealth Fighter

Spoiler

Meet the aircraft that redefined modern air warfare: The F-117A was the first combat example of all-aspect stealth, which was used to great effect in the wars of the 1980s and 1990s, despite having been introduced ten years earlier.

^ Old version

Download Link: https://kerbalx.com/servo/F-117A-Nighthawk

PZL M-15 "Belphegor"

Spoiler

The Belphegor was an odd victim of the Soviet-era modernization efforts. An agricultural jet biplane - designed to replace the decidedly un-modern An-2, it was utterly unqualified to replace the previous biplane, which ultimately outlives it to this day.

Download Link: https://kerbalx.com/servo/PZL-M-15-Belphegor

McDonnell F-4 Phantom II

Spoiler

The F-4 Phantom could do everything - air superiority, bombing, Wild Weasel, recon, aerobatic plane for the Blue Angels and the Thunderbirds, and operate in Three branches of the U.S. Military.

Download Link: https://kerbalx.com/servo/McDonnell-F-4-Phantom

 

EC-18B ARIA - Apollo Range Instrumentation Aircraft

Spoiler

The EC-18B ARIA was an odd duck of an aircraft which played an instrumental (hah!) role in the Apollo Program by providing an airborne communications link to the spacecraft crews.

Download Link: https://kerbalx.com/servo/EC-18B-ARIA

Douglas A-4 Skyhawk

Spoiler

The A-4 is the iconic light attack jet, in service for nearing 50 years of service in many air forces worldwide.

Download Link: https://kerbalx.com/servo/A-4-Skyhawk

Mikoyan Gurevich MiG-19ST "Farmer-B"

Spoiler

The MiG-19 was the Soviet Union's first production supersonic fighter, and one of the first with functioning* Air-to-Air missiles. 

Download link: https://kerbalx.com/servo/MiG-19pt

USS Johnston - Fletcher-Class Destroyer

Spoiler

The Fletcher-class Destroyer has been described as "the ship which won the Pacific". Rightly so, this versatile, heavily armed destroyer could punch well above its weight.

Download Link: https://kerbalx.com/servo/USS-Johnston

McDonnell Douglas F/A-18C/D Hornet

Spoiler

A highly detailed, highly functional replica of the U.S. Navy's primary fleet fighter. It won't disappoint, I promise.

Download link: https://kerbalx.com/servo/FA-18-CD-Hornet

Previous Version:

https://kerbalx.com/servo/FA-18B-Hornet

Armed version: https://kerbalx.com/servo/FA-18A-Armed

 

Superscale (1.3x)  Republic P-47 Thunderbolt

Spoiler

A 1.3x scale version of Republic's flying tank, the P-47 Thunderbolt. 

Download link: https://kerbalx.com/servo/P-47-Thunderbolt

Superscale (1.5x)  North American P-51D Mustang

Spoiler

If you don't know the Mustang, you don't know planes. Enjoy my first foray into prop craft - it's a good one.

Download Link: https://kerbalx.com/servo/P-51D-Mustang

Grumman YF-28 "Alleycat"

Spoiler

This is the first original craft which I've built in a long time, and the one which inspired the Original Fighter Design Competition. A Supermaneuverable F-14 Tomcat derivative.

Download link:https://kerbalx.com/servo/Grumman-YF-28-Alleycat

Design Competition: 

 

 

Northrop B-2 Spirit

Spoiler

You already know this plane, you already love it. Go ahead and try it out, but read the manual first!

Download link: https://kerbalx.com/servo/Northrop-B-2-Spirit

Martin XB-51

Spoiler

The result of a two-hour build challenge and a randomly guessed aircraft designation - Martin's weird Trijet bicycle bomber!

Download link: https://kerbalx.com/servo/Martin-XB-51

Ilyushin IL-76 "Candid"

Spoiler

Enter my highest part count craft to date - the Il-76. It was the Soviet Union's strategic airlifter, and has become almost ubiquitous as a cargo hauler, troop transport, and firefighting aircraft.

Download link: https://kerbalx.com/servo/Il-76

Convair B-58 Hustler

Spoiler

The B-58 Hustler was a staple of 70's and 80's Strategic Air Command, capable of both high and low altitude bombing runs at supersonic speeds.

Download: https://kerbalx.com/servo/Convair-B-58-Hustler

 

McDonnell F-101C / RF-101C Voodoo

Spoiler

What! A double Feature!? Here are two versions of McDonnell's almost-iconic fighter and reconnaissance aircraft. 

F-101C: https://kerbalx.com/servo/F-101C-Voodoo

RF-101C: https://kerbalx.com/servo/RF-101C-Voodoo

Grumman F11F Tiger

Spoiler

The F-11 was a mostly unremarkable early supersonic carrier aircraft, but this one flies well - just don't shoot yourself down!

Download link: https://kerbalx.com/servo/Grumman-F11F-Tiger

Panavia Tornado

Spoiler

Europe's iconic fourth-generation fighter/interceptor is back, featuring detailed bodywork, and of course, the best set of swing wings I've ever put on an aircraft.

Download it here: https://kerbalx.com/servo/Panavia-Tornado

Fairchild-Republic A-10A Thunderbolt II "Warthog"

Spoiler

The ultimate A-10, this craft features accurate visuals, hardpoints, proper flaps, and most importantly, a stock, functioning GAU-8 Avenger rotary cannon with 40 rounds.

Download link: https://kerbalx.com/servo/A-10-Warthog

 

OLD VERSION - Lower part count, no cannon

This famous ground attack and close air support craft is rugged and packs a punch, thanks to a 30mm rotary cannon.

https://kerbalx.com/servo/A-10-Thunderbolt-II

Shuttle Transport System

Spoiler

My biggest project to date, a 1:1 scale Space Shuttle.

Download Link: https://kerbalx.com/servo/11-STS

Northrop T-38 Talon

Spoiler

Take to the skies with the iconic jet trainer, chase plane, and astronaut taxi - the T-38 Talon.

Download: https://kerbalx.com/servo/T-38

Lockheed L-133 Starjet

Spoiler

Ever wanted to really turn heads? This 40's era retrofuture jet fighter is just the craft for that.

Download link: https://kerbalx.com/servo/L-133-Starjet

Yakolev Yak-38 Forger

Spoiler

The Yak-38 Forger was the Soviet response to the British Harrier - which means a fun to fly Naval VTOL fighter.

Download: https://kerbalx.com/servo/Yakolev-Yak-38

Boeing-Saab T-X Trainer Aircraft

Spoiler

Take trainer aircraft into the next century with the USAF's newest acquisition - the Boeing-Saab T-X!

Download: https://kerbalx.com/servo/Boeing-Saab-T-X

Dassault Mirage 2000

Spoiler

Enjoy this low-part replica of France's iconic fourth-generation  export fighter!

Download: https://kerbalx.com/servo/Dassault-Mirage-2000

North American F-100D Super Sabre

Spoiler

Take control of the USAF's first supersonic fighter, now in glorious 1:1 scale!

Download Link: https://kerbalx.com/servo/F-100D-Super-Sabre

 

Canadair Regional Jet CRJ-200

Spoiler

Start your own regional airline with the ubiquitous CRJ-200, complete with full flaps, spoilers, and thrust reversers.

Download: https://kerbalx.com/servo/CRJ-200

 

Mikoyan-Gurevich MiG-15 

Spoiler

Terrorize American bomber formations or tussle with Sabres in this truly iconic Korean War dogfighter.

https://kerbalx.com/servo/MiG-15

 

North American F-86 Sabre

Spoiler

Take control of the skies over the Korean Peninsula in America's finest early jet fighter.

https://kerbalx.com/servo/F-86-Sabre

 

Lockheed Martin F-22 Raptor

Spoiler

The first fifth-generation fighter - fast, maneuverable and stealthy.

Full version: https://kerbalx.com/servo/F-22-Raptor_2

Lower-part count version: https://kerbalx.com/servo/F-22-Raptor-Lite

Dassault Rafale

Spoiler

Take a spin in this supermaneuverable French air superiority fighter - it won't dissapoint.

https://kerbalx.com/servo/Dassault-Rafale

Lockheed Martin F-35 Joint Strike Fighter Lightning II

Spoiler

This F-35B is well polished inside and out, with a smooth exterior, air-to-air missiles, and the type-defining VTOL swivel engines.

https://kerbalx.com/servo/F-35B-Lightning-II

Republic F-84 Thunderjet

Spoiler

A revisit of one of my early craft, much improved aesthetics and it handles like a dream. Just take it for a spin, you'll understand why.

https://kerbalx.com/servo/Republic-F-84-Thunderjet

Concorde

Spoiler

Take a front-row seat on the iconic supersonic airliner and appreciate a unique piece of aviation history, complete with an actuating nose.

https://kerbalx.com/servo/Concorde

General Dynamics F-16 Fighting Falcon

Spoiler

A classic fourth-generation fighter, with low part count and powerful engines allowing for extreme performance.

https://kerbalx.com/servo/F-16A-Fighting-Falcon

Grumman F-14 Tomcat (MULTIPLE VERSIONS)

Spoiler

My newest version of the iconic fleet defense fighter, with improved ruggedness, maneuverability, and most importantly, looks.

https://kerbalx.com/servo/F-14-Tomcat_2

OLD VERSION

This Tom is as fully featured as they come - swing wings, full red-alert loadout with air-to-air missiles, airbrakes, tailhook, and drop tanks.

Download: https://kerbalx.com/servo/Grumman-F-14-Tomcat

 

McDonnell Douglas / Boeing F-15 Eagle + F-15 ACTIVE STOL/MTD

Spoiler

A highly capable fighter for modern air warfare, this F-15 features a loadout of replica air-to-air missiles capable of destroying a squadron of lesser aircraft.

Download: https://kerbalx.com/servo/Boeing-F-15-Eagle

F-15 ACTIVE/STOL/MTD

This modified F-15 includes thrust vectoring, forward canards, and advanced fly-by-wire software, making it extremely maneuverable for its size.

Download link: https://kerbalx.com/servo/F-15-ACTIVE

McDonnell Douglas AV-8B Harrier II

Spoiler

The Harrier II was an early VTOL "Jump Jet", featuring swiveling exhaust ports allowing for short and vertical takeoff and landing.

Download: https://kerbalx.com/servo/AV-8B-Harrier-II

Lockheed NF-104A "Zoom Climber"

Spoiler

This precursor to the X-15 added rocket engines to the already advanced Starfighter, allowing it to train future test pilots and astronauts.

https://kerbalx.com/servo/NF-104A

Sukhoi Su-27M/Su-35 Flanker-E

Spoiler

This updated fourth-generation Russian fighter is known for its supermaneuverabilty, thanks to thrust vectoring engines and canards.

https://kerbalx.com/servo/Su-35

More will be posted as I make them. Feel free to suggest favorite craft for me to take on!

Completed A-10 has been added to the OP!

About to put the NF-104 and the A-10 to the preformance test
IT IS THE A-10 THUNDERBOLT II The Lightning II is the F-35
Came up with another replica Idea... Sukhoi T-50 aka PAK FA aka Su-57. Please attempt.
I've got a few cool 1:1 replicas, mind if I share some too?

6 hours ago, MajaeV said:

I'm in love with your MiG-21 Bis - I want to see what else you (and everyone else) have been up to!

 

If I may, I'd like to put a spotlight on Gelo10102 on KerbalX (https://kerbalx.com/Gelo10102). His F-22, YF-23, and A-5 (well, all of them) are absolutely spot on.

As you wish...

*makes airplane noises*

Su-27M / Su-35 Flanker-E has been added to the OP!

Download: https://kerbalx.com/servo/Su-35

It's been a while! Work progressed slowly on my new version of the F-14, but it's finally been added to the OP.

Download: https://kerbalx.com/servo/F-14-Tomcat_2

Looking to pick up more work over the summer. I aim to complete the fourth-generation fighters soon before moving on to something new. Expect a F/A-18 eventually, with a Tornado or Eurofighter somewhere in the lineup.

But for now, here's the F-16 that I've been working on for the past few days: https://kerbalx.com/servo/F-16A-Fighting-Falcon

Have a favorite craft you'd like to see instead? I'm always looking for a challenge.

Edited June 19, 2018 by Servo

Double Feature today! Concorde and Hornet are at the top of the OP

https://kerbalx.com/servo/Concorde

https://kerbalx.com/servo/FA-18B-Hornet

F-35B is added to the OP! Take a spin in the VTOL fifth-generation fighter. Incredibly maneuverable and handles well at slow speeds. Plus, it looks awesome.

Plus a sneak peek at my latest project - who said 1:1 wasn't just for aircraft?

Rounding out my tour of American Combat aircraft, we have the world's first fifth-generation fighter, the F-22 Raptor.

It comes in two versions - full visual: https://kerbalx.com/servo/F-22-Raptor_2 and performance: https://kerbalx.com/servo/F-22-Raptor-Lite

 

Now that I've built every active-duty fighter or attack aircraft in the U.S. arsenal, it was only appropriate that I line up the fleet for a photo op.

On 7/29/2018 at 11:17 AM, Servo said:

Now that I've built every active-duty fighter or attack aircraft in the U.S. arsenal, it was only appropriate that I line up the fleet for a photo op.﻿

Bravo, bravo! Phenomenal work @Servo! *salutes*

What software do you use to do your overlays? I'm having a hard time finding something that will actually overlay over my game window.

On 8/1/2018 at 3:44 AM, SkunkTwerks said:

Bravo, bravo! Phenomenal work @Servo! *salutes*

What software do you use to do your overlays? I'm having a hard time finding something that will actually overlay over my game window.

The zoom/lighting effects come from a combination of Scatterer and Camera Tools. The image of all six planes is an unedited screenshot - I just put it in stationary camera mode, zoomed in, and moved the camera until I got an angle I liked. If you're asking about the titles with the name of the craft, I edited the image in paint.net.
